image.altText: A crowd of people walking together along a red dirt road in the outback.

props.synopsis: Gough Whitlam poured sand into the hands of Vincent Lingiari 50 years ago, marking the first Aboriginal community to be given land back from the Commonwealth — but Gurindji leaders say more still needs to be done to ensure economic prosperity.

title.children: It's been half a century since land was returned to these traditional owners

image.altText: A man with olive complexion, brown hair that rests on forehead, head resting on chin, sitting and looking to left.

props.synopsis: A coronial inquest has heard that a man who shot his ex-partner in the stomach before taking his own life had made attempts to seek help in the weeks prior to the tragedy.

title.children: Police missed 'red flags' prior to attempted murder-suicide, inquest hears

image.altText: A line of election candidate corflutes on a wide pavement, on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: As Northern Territorians head to the polls for local government elections today, academics and politicians say not enough is being done to encourage Aboriginal voter participation.

title.children: Low turnout among Aboriginal voters a concern ahead of NT local elections

image.altText: A man wearing a tie walking with a woman outside.

props.synopsis: Accusations of lies and collusion along with profanity-laden secret phone recordings have taken centre stage in the third week of the high-profile trial against Matt Wright.

title.children: 'Stick to the Matt Wright party line': Witnesses accused of lying in trial

image.altText: Two Aboriginal men on a dark lit stage with orchestra behind them. Left man playing didigeridoo, right playing clapsticks

props.synopsis: A Yolŋu songman has collaborated with the Darwin Symphony Orchestra to create a musical experience combining ancient songlines with a classical ensemble.

title.children: Ancient songlines from Arnhem Land meet a classical symphony on Darwin stage

image.altText: A Northern Territory Police car.

props.synopsis: Northern Territory police have charged a 48-year-old man over the alleged fatal poisoning of his female partner in March last year.

title.children: Man charged 18 months after alleged fatal poisoning of female partner

image.altText: Esther Perel

props.synopsis: Sharing feelings and downloading troubles with others occurs naturally when these close connections are maintained.

title.children: Unpicking the mental load of 'mankeeping' amid a male loneliness epidemic

image.altText: A mugshot of a man with his eyes partially closed.

props.synopsis: WA Police hunt a man who escaped from court on Friday afternoon, after appearing on "serious sexual offences".

title.children: Police hunt man who escaped custody after court appearance on sex charges

image.altText: Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein sitting together at a table with a bloody mary cocktail before them

props.synopsis: The transcripts with Ghislaine Maxwell are released as the Trump administration suffers a sustained backlash from its base over failing to deliver on expectations created through conspiracy theories and bold promises.

title.children: Ghislaine Maxwell told US officials Trump was 'never inappropriate'

image.altText: Spirit IV docked at Macquarie Wharf in Hobart

props.synopsis: Spirit of Tasmania IV has at last arrived in the state, eight years after the Tasmanian government embarked on a project to replace the two ships currently in operation. The other new ferry remains in Finland, where they were built.

title.children: 'She's beautiful': New Spirit of Tasmania ferry arrives in Hobart

image.altText: AI image: An orange, red and black coloured Aboriginal-style dot painting created with the generative AI Midjourney.

props.synopsis: We asked ChatGPT to create authentic Indigenous artworks and stories. Experts say what it produced — while "quick, easy and cheap" — represents a profound threat to First Nations cultures.

title.children: We asked AI to make Indigenous art. What it produced shows its great threat

image.altText: Jim Chalmers in the foreground in focus, with Anthony Albanese in the background out of focus, from the right hand side

props.synopsis: If nothing else, this week's round table may have started the long overdue debate on difficult topics that was sorely absent during the election campaign.

title.children: Chalmers opens 'stunningly fragile' reform window

image.altText: Bailey J. Williams of the Eagles celebrates a goal with teammates

props.synopsis: First and second on the AFL ladder have been decided with the Adelaide Crows and Geelong Cats securing wins on Saturday. Follow live.

title.children: Eagles stun Swans with early goals as West Coast hunt second win of year

image.altText: Mark Nawaqanitawase catches a ball above the Eels.

props.synopsis: Mark Nawaqanitawase adds to his highlight reel with a stunning try assist, but the Roosters are struggling without Sam Walker after a concussion early in their clash with the Eels. Follow live.

title.children: Magic Mark produces another miracle but Eels extend shock lead

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: What a try! And the Fox has two
Mark Nawaqanitawase pulls another rabbit out of his hat

image.altText: Cute Jack russell terrier dog with a rubber toy ball inside a carrier for animals in a neutral interior.

props.synopsis: Some pet owners will soon be able to fly with their cat or dog on some domestic routes. Here's how to prepare your pet for busy airports and in-cabin flights.

title.children: Looking forward to ‘pet-friendly’ flights in Australia? Here’s what experts say

image.altText: Three uniformed police officers stand next to a police car parked in front of a house surrounded by police tape.

props.synopsis: A 24-year-old man is charged with murder after a 55-year-old man with significant facial injuries was found dead at a home in Goulburn on Friday morning.

title.children: Man charged with murder after 55yo found dead in Goulburn

image.altText: A black and white photo of Pamela Digby holding the arm of Winston Churchill on the steps of a church surrounded by wellwishers.

props.synopsis: Pamela Digby was just 19 years old when she agreed to marry UK prime minister Winston Churchill's only son, Randolph, on the day they first met. The union, short as it was, changed the course of her whole life.

title.children: Was this aristocrat a ruthless social climber or the UK's 'secret weapon'?

image.altText: Glass shattered on the floor of a house

props.synopsis: Three people are stabbed following an alleged home invasion in Melbourne's west, police say.

title.children: Three stabbed in home invasion in Melbourne's west

image.altText: Harry Grant with his hands on his head

props.synopsis: Melbourne Storm captain Harry Grant is handed a two-match ban for a shoulder charge as Bulldogs coach Cameron Ciraldo continues to be puzzled by a controversial Bunker ruling.

title.children: Storm skipper Grant suspended as Bunker drama leaves Dogs puzzled

image.altText: A man with short hair wearing a yellow, white and black sweater sits in a classroom smiling, with children in the background.

props.synopsis: After never seeing primary school teaching as a career path, Ryan Brown now believes he's found his "calling", but he's one of just two male classroom teachers at his Canberra primary school.

title.children: Many primary school kids will never have a male teacher, and experts say that's a problem

image.altText: A three image composite of Terrance Stamp, Winnie the Pooh and Ash Centra.

props.synopsis: We've collected some of the most jaw-dropping, eyebrow-raising or mildly confusing quotes in the news this week. See how you go with our first quote quiz.

title.children: ABC Quote Quiz: Who said it, and what were they on about?

image.altText: an older man and woman inside a door frame

props.synopsis: It took more than a year for Kathleen Whelan's husband Alan to get an assessment for in-home aged care. Ten months later, he has seen no assistance.

title.children: Wife told to abandon husband at hospital to get home care assessment

image.altText: Kimar Abergo Garcia in a white button up shirt with two men beside him.

props.synopsis: Kilmar Abrego Garcia will be on home detention in Maryland with his brother.

title.children: Kilmar Abrego Garcia freed from jail to await trial with family while on home detention

image.altText: Jacob King rides a bike on a street in Geraldton, WA.

props.synopsis: Jacob King is voluntarily putting himself through immense pain and discomfort to raise money for sick kids who do not have a choice and face pain every day.

title.children: Cyclist battling pain and sickness to tackle Australia's 'four points' challenge

image.altText: A black and white portrait photo of Paul Kelly, wearing a business shirt and folding hands in front of his face.

props.synopsis: Paul Kelly's surprise sequel to How To Make Gravy proves that sometimes one song just isn't enough. Here are some of the best sequel tracks in music history.

title.children: From Buddy Holly to Metallica, here are some of the best sequel songs

image.altText: Donald Trump visits a temporary migrant detention center informally known as "Alligator Alcatraz"

props.synopsis: The order said that authorities must remove "all generators, gas, sewage, and other waste and waste receptacles that were installed to support this project", within 60 days.

title.children: Judge orders dismantling of Trump's 'Alligator Alcatraz' detention facility

image.altText: A woman wearing a yellow and white flower above her ear, a large black necklace and a green and yellow patterned dress.

props.synopsis: Samoans will vote for their next government on August 29 in elections that have been defined by soaring cost-of-living pressures, blackouts and political turmoil.

title.children: Fate of the Pacific's 'Iron Lady' could rest on a $50 box of chicken

image.altText: People in FBI jackets load up a car with evidence boxes

props.synopsis: John Bolton served in the US president's first administration as national security adviser, but later became critical of Donald Trump.

title.children: FBI raids home and office of vocal Trump critic John Bolton

image.altText: A group of first responders standing beside the tour bus on its side.

props.synopsis: Injuries from the bus crash ranged from head trauma to broken arms and legs.

title.children: At least five killed after tour bus from Niagara Falls to New York City crashes

image.altText: A massive open cut gold mine with a series of large haul trucks operating.

props.synopsis: Kalgoorlie's 4.5 kilometre-long Super Pit mine comes back from the brink, striving to reclaim its crown as Australia's biggest-producing gold mine.

title.children: Record gold price spurs renaissance of 'super' 3,500km tunnel mine

image.altText: Queensland Parliament House in Brisbane through its front fence on George Street.

props.synopsis: The guidelines include that they "must not" discuss or post anything about funded programs with "anyone in the media or related to media".

title.children: Government accused of 'media gag' on youth justice organisations

image.altText: Josh Willie a man in his 40s with pale skin and dark hair. He is sitting in front of a radio microphone and wearing headphones.

props.synopsis: Listening to the new Tasmanian Labor leader's first media interviews, you'd be forgiven for thinking little had changed. But the subtle shifts in language suggest a change in the party's direction.

title.children: Long road back for Tasmanian Labor under Willie must start now

image.altText: A child playing with colourful toys.

props.synopsis: Australia's long overdue reforms to improve safety across the nation's childcare centres are a start but still a long way off best practice compared to other countries, writes Conor Duffy.

title.children: Spotlight on childcare reforms reveals how far there is to go

image.altText: Ken Hinkley at a media conference.

props.synopsis: Any coach embarking on a 13-year reign at an AFL club would probably accept 12 wooden spoons if they came with a single silver cup — but while that prize eluded Ken Hinkley's Port Adelaide, he is departing the Power with the blessing of the "footy gods".

title.children: Hinkley's time is up, but he's the 'proudest coach the world has seen'

image.altText: A couple dressed as vikings in leather armour sitting on a hill in the sunshine.

props.synopsis: Scottish-born Alpin Grant, aka King Alpin Wülfhammer, has made his dream of being a medieval knight a reality, and a whole town celebrates with him.

title.children: Town celebrates 30 years of swords, sorcery and other medieval revels
